hedline.hl1: World Business Briefing | Asia: South Korea: Growth Forecast Of 3.9%

abstract.p: Bank of Korea forecasts 3.9 percent economic growth for South Korea in 2002; stocks rise (S)

block.p: The Bank of Korea has forecast economic growth of 3.9 percent next year, citing consumer consumption and the recovery of the construction industry. The forecast followed a forecast of 2.8 percent growth this year and contributed to an optimistic mood among investors. The Korea Stock Exchange price index broke the 700 mark, rising 17.89 points to close the week at 704.50, its highest level since Aug. 30 of last year. The rise reflected improving export markets overseas as well as an increase in share prices of steel manufacturers, led by Pohang Iron and Steel, up 5.8 percent, in anticipation of a decline in American production.
